meanings.definition: The state or quality of being humble or modest.
meanings.sent1: Her lowlihead was evident in the way she always put others before herself.
meanings.sent2: His lowlihead shone through when he quietly accepted the praise without seeking more attention.
meanings.sent3: Despite his lowlihead, he couldn't help but blush when complimented on his cooking skills.
meanings.sent4: The tree's lowlihead as it bent gracefully in the wind was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The old man's lowlihead was like a gentle breeze, calming those around him.

meanings.definition: The act of behaving in a humble or modest manner.
meanings.sent1: She showed her lowlihead by always listening attentively to others.
meanings.sent2: His lowlihead was evident in the way he never boasted about his accomplishments.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's lowlihead on stage had the audience laughing at his self-deprecating jokes.
meanings.sent4: The lowlihead of the flower as it bowed to the sun was a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent5: The student's lowlihead in accepting feedback helped her improve her writing skills.
